Fields.FinancialBankConnectIntro:
Why should I link my bank account?
Why make yourself difficult by always downloading your bank files such as MT940 or CAMT053. Why do you find it difficult, for example, to always have your accountant on the phone with the question: Have your latest bank transactions been uploaded!? To save yourself all that misery and simply to make it easy for yourself. Can you InvoiceHippo access your business bank account. This way we can collect your latest bank transactions every day and your data is always up to date! Nice and easy right?

Is it safe to pair?
Secure! Our link goes through a secure connection. The partner who provides us with this, Nordigen, has a special license for this.

And my data?
Your data just stays in InvoiceHippo, under lock and key. Everything runs via a secure connection, just like your bank does. We do not sell customer data.

Synchronization cycle
InvoiceHippo performs a daily synchronization in the early morning, which is around: 06:00
Fields.FinancialBankConnectPeriodeStartI: You will be given the choice to indicate from which date the bank transactions must be synchronized!                    However, this only works for accounts that will be newly linked or for existing accounts for which no changes have been uploaded yet.                    In the event that mutations have been uploaded, the process will try to start the synchronization after the last known mutation date!

Fields.RemoveAccountDescription: Do you want to delete your InvoiceHippo account? For example, because you no longer use the account or because you have found another platform? You can delete the account. It means that all your data disappears at InvoiceHippo. Think of invoices, receipts, attachments, but really everything. Also, the use of our app (s) is no longer possible. So first consider whether you really want this. Otherwise, please contact us to see if we can help you with your wishes or dissatisfaction.

Fields.GeneratedFileNameFormatInfo:
Determine the format of the file names of your invoices here. Below you see an example and what the possibilities are.

For example: invoice_%invoice_nr% becomes invoice_I{0}-0001.pdf

Placeholders:
%invoice nr% = invoice number
%datetoday% = day of download
%timetoday% = time of download
%invoice date% = date of the invoice
%customer% = customer company name
%customernr% = customernumber
%year% = current year of download
Fields.InvoiceNrFormatInfo:
Determine the format of your invoice numbers here. Below you see an example and what the possibilities are.

For example: I%year%-%nr% becomes I{0}-0001

Placeholders:
%yyyy% = current year, example: {0}
%yy% = current year, example: {1}
%nr% = current invoice index, example: 0001
%nr1% = current invoice index, example: 1
%nr2% = current invoice index, example: 01
%nr3% = current invoice index, example: 001
%fdd% = day invoice date, example: {1}
%fmm% = month billing date, example: 05
%fyy% = year invoice date, example: {1}
%fyyyy% = year invoice date, example: {0}
Fields.QuoteNrFormatInfo:
Determine the format of your quotation numbers here. Below you see an example and what the possibilities are.

For example: O%year%-%nr% becomes O{0}-0001

Placeholders:
%yyyy% = current year, example: {0}
%yy% = current year, example: {1}
%nr% = current quotation index, example: 0001
%nr1% = current quotation index, example: 1
%nr2% = current quotation index, example: 01
%nr3% = current quotation index, example: 001
%fdd% = day quotation date, example: {1}
%fmm% = month quote date, example: 05
%fyy% = year quote date, example: {1}
%fyyyy% = year quotation date, example: {0}

Fields.TemplateEnableCustomTemplatePreIn: Within InvoiceHippo you have the option to use an x ​​number of predefined invoice/quotation templates. But would you like to decide for yourself what your invoice/quote looks like and what you want to show on it? Then use the option below to use your own template.
Fields.TemplateEnableCustomTemplatePostI:
Within InvoiceHippo you have the option to set up your own MS Word Template for your invoices and/or quotations. On this page you can see which keys/placeholders you can use within the template. The instruction block briefly summarizes how to use the keys within a template can use. Download as an example our template and get started right away creating your unique template.

NB! We use the standard template as default, provided you have uploaded your own template here! If you forget to upload a template, one of our predefined templates will be used by default! If you have previously selected a template from here, the specific selected template type will be used as default. In this way, the system ensures that an invoice or quotation can always be sent!
Fields.TemplatePredefinedTemplateSelecti: select one of our predefined templates

Select here one of our predefined invoice templates by simply clicking on it. Don't forget to click save after making your selection. You can see an example by creating a new invoice and then choosing the preview option, otherwise you can also do the same with an existing invoice.
Fields.TemplateShowErrorsOnCustomTemplat: show template errors while downloading the invoice

This option gives you the opportunity to detect any errors in your template. Turn this option off and prevent customers from seeing these errors too! Only use this when setting up a new template and if you want to find out why the generation process is not going well
Fields.TemplateMergeInstructions:
Instructions
Here you can see in which ways a placeholder key can be used within an MS Word template.
All keys without a switch attribute behind them must be used in the following way:
  • <<[CustomerNo]>>
All keys with an html switch attribute behind them must be used in the following way:
  • <<[CustomerNo] -html>>
All keys with an if switch attribute behind them can be used in the following way:
  • <<if [HasCompanyKvkNr]>> ... <</if>>
  • <<if [HasCompanyLogoUrl]>> ... <<elseif [HasInvoiceDeliveryDate]>> ... <</if>>
  • <<if [HasCompanyLogoUrl]>> ... <<elseif [HasCompanyKvkNr] ... <<elseif [HasInvoiceDeliveryDate]>> ... <</if>>
All keys with a foreach switch attribute behind them can be used in the following way:
  • <<foreach [in Products]>> ... <</foreach>>
  • <<foreach [in CustomFields]>> <<[Title]>> ... <</foreach>>
  • <<foreach [in Products]>> <<[Title]>>, <<[UnitPrice]>> ... <</foreach>>
For the rest it is of course possible to combine these statements as you see fit!
See below for the possible placeholders per category.
Fields.TermsAndConditionsAndExtraAttachm:
Within InvoiceHippo you have the option to send your general terms and conditions as attachments to both invoices and quotations. The conditions must be uploaded as a PDF file! Please note that you must also upload the general terms and conditions separately for quotations if you would like them to be added as an additional attachment to quotations.

You also have the option to add an extra attachment for the invoices only! As an extra attachment, a PDF or an Excel document can be linked. The extra attachment is always sent regardless of the status of the option to send the general terms and conditions or not!
activate this option if you would like to send the general terms and conditions as an extra attachment to invoices
activate this option if you would like to send the general terms and conditions as an extra attachment to quotations

DashboardIntro.WelcomeWizP1Description1:
Before you get started!
We are happy to help you on your way, so we ask you to take a few steps to organize your account completely well. This will take you less than 1 minute of your time. You can then immediately prepare and send your first invoice.
DashboardIntro.WelcomeWizP1Description2: This wizard is here to easily guide you in setting up your account!
DashboardIntro.WelcomeWizP3DoYouHaveAlte: Do you have a different invoice address?
This billing address is used by <strong>InvoiceHippo<strong> to bill you if you decide to purchase a paid package.
DashboardIntro.WelcomeWizP4IntroductionI:
These are your starting numbers for invoices, products, quotations and customers.
This means that at each turn of the year your series, for example invoice numbers, start again with this number.

Here you can configure how, for example, an invoice number should be formatted. This way you can generate an invoice number that is entirely according to your taste. The same also applies to products, quotations and customers.
